answers.author: Amanda Dodge
answers.text:
Hi David,
I have been able to find a few resources that should provide you with some answers. I was unable to find many actual policies, but there was a lot of information available on specifications and standards for energy efficient computers.
The Clean Air Partnership in Toronto, Ontario created an ENERGY STAR Procurement Toolkit for Municipalities in 2005. On page 19 of the pdf there is a table of specifications for ENGERGY STAR qualified computers. Additionally, on page 54-55 there is sample language to use when ordering the computers:
http://bit.ly/jC4xUR 
ENERGY STAR has also released a list of qualified notebooks and  lists their relevant energy efficiency information:
http://bit.ly/kkA2BN
Also, Boston, Massachusetts has created the Green Information Technology Roadmap to reduce the amount of waster energy in the city and improve energy efficiency. The policy related to purchasing computers is located on the bottom of the first page and continues onto the second page:
http://1.usa.gov/mp9wMp 
I hope these help!
Amanda Dodge
International City/County Management Association
Knowledge Network Intern
202-962-3699
adodge@icma.org
